author: @91vasanth
text: hey there buddy.. got stuck with a scenario with live graph updates. i have a function that continuously writes to a file and i am updating my live graph from this file it self. the File writing is happening in a separate thread.  so as soon as my scripts starts, the grapgh window starts off and the data is getting updated in my file. but the Graph seems not to be changing at all :(  here;s my file writer function:   def FileWriter():  f=open('F:\\home\\WorkSpace\\FIrstPyProject\\TestModules\\sampleText.txt','w')  k=0  i=0  while (k < 20):   i+=1   j=randint(10,19)   data = f.write(str(i)+','+str(j)+'\n')   print("wrote data")   time.sleep(2)   k += 1  and my Main:  def Main():  t1=Thread(target=FileWriter)  t1.start()  ani = animation.FuncAnimation(fig, animate, interval=1000)  plt.show()  print("done")  and the animate function is pretty same as you have shown in your tutorial here :)  please help :(

text:
Hi Sentdex.  Great python tutorials.  When I have the statement :-  dataArray = pullData.split('
') I get the following errors :-  >>> runfile('/home/marty/Python programs/Stock Market/Animated_plot.py', wdir=r'/home/marty/Python programs/Stock Market') Traceback (most recent call last):   File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/spyderlib/widgets/externalshell/sitecustomize.py", line 540, in runfile     execfile(filename, namespace)   File "/home/marty/Python programs/Stock Market/Animated_plot.py", line 40, in <module>     ani = animation.FuncAnimation(fig,animate,interval=1000)   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/matplotlib/animation.py", line 1010, in __init__     TimedAnimation.__init__(self, fig, **kwargs)   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/matplotlib/animation.py", line 864, in __init__     *args, **kwargs)   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/matplotlib/animation.py", line 545, in __init__     self._init_draw()   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/matplotlib/animation.py", line 1035, in _init_draw     self._draw_frame(next(self.new_frame_seq()))   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/matplotlib/animation.py", line 1049, in _draw_frame     self._drawn_artists = self._func(framedata, *self._args)   File "/home/marty/Python programs/Stock Market/Animated_plot.py", line 19, in animate     dataArray = pullData.split('

text: Harrison, you are the man!  I'm teaching myself python for a spacecraft simulation based application using an inertial measurement unit (serial USB connection).  I'm trying to get live updating plot that shows the pitch history over time updated every 500 ms.  Thanks to you, I learned about pandas and how to save my arrays into those and export out to a csv file.  I'm following your course on pythonprogramming.net (GREAT SITE) and your bitcoin live updating graph is exactly what I'm looking for.  How can you read a live updating list in pandas and plot it with those arrays?  I'm a little confused as you are reading data from a website and I'm trying to do it in program.  Thanks so much!
